subject: Marketing
title: Loss Aversion
description: A quick win: understand Loss Aversion.

hook.text: Losing $100 hurts twice as much as gaining $100 feels good.

buildup.text: Kahneman and Tversky proved humans weight losses far more heavily than equivalent gains.

discovery.text: Loss aversion powers free trials, money-back guarantees, and 'don't miss out' copy.

twist.text: Once you possess somethingâ€”even brieflyâ€”giving it up feels like a real loss.

climax.text: Free trials work because canceling feels like losing, not just stopping.

punchline.text: People buy to avoid losing, not to gain.

quiz.question: Why are free trials such an effective marketing tool?
options: Canceling feels like a loss once you have the product
They give customers time to read reviews
Trials reduce the company's advertising costs
